last_post.content:
I am taking over the running of our PhD programmes and so naturally my first action is to advertise on the Fediverse.

The School of Computer Science at the University of St Andrews has a number of funded PhD places this year. First deadline is 1 Feb - see https://blogs.cs.st-andrews.ac.uk/csblog/2022/11/02/phd-scholarships-for-2023/. St Andrews is a nice place to live and study, especially if you like the sea, golf, haggis or all three. We have lots of great supervisors who are interested in all areas of Computer Science (as well as people like me who dabble in other fields such as law) - see https://www.st-andrews.ac.uk/computer-science/prospective/pgr/supervisors/

Please consider applying or sharing with anyone who might be interested in postgraduate research. We also offer EngD, MSc(Res) and MPhil degrees - see https://www.st-andrews.ac.uk/computer-science/prospective/pgr/

The Computer History Museum in Mountain View has worked with Apple to secure the release of the source code for the OS and office applications of the #AppleLisa computer.

title: Why is Fast Fashion Bad? Here's What You Need to Know.

last_post.content:
Fast Fashion Facts:
- We buy 60% more than we did in 2000 but each garment is kept for half as long.
- Of the billions of clothing items made each year, over half are thrown away.
- The fashion industry employs millions of people but only around 2% earn a living wage.
- 60% of clothes are made from synthetic fabrics derived from fossil fuels.
- The production of textiles produces almost 1.2 billion tonnes of CO2 per year.
#fastfashion
